content:
TITLE: Remote Repository Operations
DESCRIPTION: Commands for syncing with remote repositories including pulling and pushing changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/998-git-commands-cheat-sheet.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git pull origin branch_name
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git push origin branch_name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Switching to a New Git Branch
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a new Git branch called 'newFeature' and switch to it in a single command. It also demonstrates how to check which branch you're currently on.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-git-branching.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout -b newFeature
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git branch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Committing Changes in Git
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to commit staged changes in Git using the 'git commit' command. It includes an explanation of the command structure and the importance of writing descriptive commit messages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/010-git-commit.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git commit -m "Your Commit Message Here"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Git Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands for starting a new Git repository locally or cloning an existing remote repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/998-git-commands-cheat-sheet.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git init .
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone your_project_url
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning a GitHub Repository using SSH
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the git clone command to clone a GitHub repository using an SSH URL. It includes the command syntax and an example of the output you might see when cloning a repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/020-git-clone.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone git@github.com:bobbyiliev/introduction-to-bash-scripting.git
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Cloning into 'introduction-to-bash-scripting'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 21, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (21/21), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (16/16), done.
remote: Total 215 (delta 7), reused 14 (delta 4), pack-reused 194
Receiving objects: 100% (215/215), 3.08 MiB | 5.38 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (114/114), done.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Git User Identity
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up global Git configuration for user name and email used in commits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/998-git-commands-cheat-sheet.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git config --global user.email "yourmail@example.com"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Git Branch Merge
DESCRIPTION: Commands to merge a feature branch into the main branch
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/018-git-merge.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout main
git merge newFeature
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating SSH Key Pair using ssh-keygen
DESCRIPTION: Command to generate a new SSH key pair that creates both private (id_rsa) and public (id_rsa.pub) keys in the ~/.ssh directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/014-ssh-keys.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ssh-keygen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing Changes to Remote GitHub Repository
DESCRIPTION: Command to push local branch changes to the remote GitHub repository. This makes your changes available to other collaborators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/022-git-workflow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git push origin YOUR_BRANCH_NAME
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing Commits to Remote GitHub Repository
DESCRIPTION: This command pushes your local commits to the remote GitHub repository. The '-u origin main' option sets the upstream branch, allowing future 'git push' and 'git pull' commands to work as intended.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/015-git-push.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git push -u origin main
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Gitignore File
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new .gitignore file in your project directory
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/013-gitignore-file.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
touch .gitignore
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linking Local Git Project to Remote GitHub Repository using SSH
DESCRIPTION: This command adds a remote GitHub repository to your local Git project using SSH authentication. Replace 'your_username' and 'your_repo_name' with your actual GitHub username and repository name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/015-git-push.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git remote add origin git@github.com:your_username/your_repo_name.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning or Initializing a Git Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands to either clone an existing project or initialize a new one. These are typically the first steps in starting a Git-based project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/022-git-workflow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone
git init
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Committing All Changes Without Staging in Git
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to commit all changes in a Git repository without explicitly staging them first. It uses the '-a' flag to automatically stage all modifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/010-git-commit.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git commit -a -m "Your Commit Message Here"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linking Local Git Project to Remote GitHub Repository using HTTPS
DESCRIPTION: This command adds a remote GitHub repository to your local Git project using HTTPS authentication. Use this if you haven't set up SSH. Replace 'your_username' and 'your_repo_name' with your actual GitHub username and repository name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/015-git-push.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git remote add origin https://github.com/your_username/your_repo_name.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting a Git Branch Locally and Remotely
DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to delete a Git branch both locally and on the remote repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-git-branching.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git branch -d name_of_the_branch
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git push origin --delete name_of_the_branch
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git fetch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Amending the Latest Commit in Git
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to amend the latest commit in Git, allowing you to add forgotten files or make small changes to the committed files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/019-undoing-in-git.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git commit --amend
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing a New Branch to GitHub
DESCRIPTION: This command pushes your new branch to GitHub. Replace 'branch_name' with the name of your branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/023-pull-requests.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git push origin branch_name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Ignoring Directories
DESCRIPTION: Example of ignoring vendor and node_modules directories in .gitignore
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/013-gitignore-file.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# Ignored folders
/vendor/
node_modules/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Git Switch Branch Command
DESCRIPTION: The basic syntax for switching to a different branch using the git switch command. This command is a more focused alternative to git checkout, specifically designed for branch switching operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/029-git-switch.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git switch <branch-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning a Repository with GitHub CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to clone a GitHub repository using the gh command instead of the traditional git clone.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/025-github-cli.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
gh repo clone thedevdojo/larasail
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Diff Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to check differences between branches before merging
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/018-git-merge.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git diff newFeature
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Commit History with Git Log
DESCRIPTION: This command displays the entire commit history of the repository, showing commit IDs, author information, dates, and commit messages in reverse chronological order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/012-git-log.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git log
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Committing Changes in Git
DESCRIPTION: Command to commit staged changes to the local repository. A descriptive commit message should be provided to explain the changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/022-git-workflow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git commit
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authenticating with GitHub CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command initiates the authentication process for the GitHub CLI, allowing users to log in to their GitHub account.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/025-github-cli.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
gh auth login
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Automatic Commit Signing in Git
DESCRIPTION: This command enables automatic signing for all Git commits. It sets a global configuration to sign every commit without needing to specify the '-S' flag each time.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/010-git-commit.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git config --global commit.gpgsign true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Stash with Ignored Files
DESCRIPTION: Command to stash changes including both untracked and ignored files specified in .gitignore.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/026-git-stash.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git stash -a
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Pull Command Example
DESCRIPTION: Command to pull the latest changes from the main branch of the remote repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/016-git-pull.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git pull origin main
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Stash with Untracked Files
DESCRIPTION: Command to stash changes including untracked files that weren't part of the last commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/026-git-stash.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git stash -u
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Comparing Git Branches
DESCRIPTION: These commands show how to compare commits and differences between two branches in Git.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-git-branching.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git log BranchA..BranchB
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git diff BranchB...BranchA
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Single File in Git
DESCRIPTION: Shows the basic syntax for adding a single file to Git tracking using git add command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/009-git-add.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git add NAME_OF_FILE
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Condensed Commit History
DESCRIPTION: This command shows a simplified version of the commit history with only the commit IDs and messages displayed on single lines, making it easier to quickly scan through the history.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/012-git-log.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git log --oneline
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Git Email
DESCRIPTION: Sets the global Git email address that will be associated with all commits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/005-git-configuration.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git config --global user.email johndoe@example.com
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating a Feature Branch with Git Rebase in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to update a feature branch with new commits from the dev branch using Git rebase. It's useful for keeping feature branches up-to-date with the latest changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/028-git-rebase.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git rebase dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Commit History for a Specific File in Git
DESCRIPTION: This command shows the commit history for a specific file in a Git repository. The '--follow' flag ensures that the history is traced even if the file was renamed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/010-git-commit.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git log --follow [file]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Restore Stashed Changes
DESCRIPTION: Command to reapply stashed modifications while keeping them in the stash list.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/026-git-stash.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git stash apply
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Branch Operations
DESCRIPTION: Commands for listing, creating, switching, and deleting branches.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/998-git-commands-cheat-sheet.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git branch -a
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git branch branch_name
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout -b branch_name
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git branch -d branch_name
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout branch_name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Git Alias with git config
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a Git alias 'co' for the 'checkout' command using the git config command with the --global flag. This configuration will apply across all repositories for the user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/027-git-alias.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git config --global alias.co checkout
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resetting Git Commits
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to reset Git commits using the soft reset option. It undoes the commit but keeps the code changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/019-undoing-in-git.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git reset --soft HEAD~1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Git User Information
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up the global Git username and email configuration required for commits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/024-git-and-VS-Code.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git config --global user.name "John Doe"
git config --global user.email "johnde@domain.com"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Laravel Gitignore Example
DESCRIPTION: Standard .gitignore configuration for Laravel projects
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/013-gitignore-file.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
/node_modules
/public/hot
/public/storage
/storage/*.key
/vendor
.env
.env.backup
.phpunit.result.cache
Homestead.json
Homestead.yaml
npm-debug.log
yarn-error.log
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Renaming a Git Branch
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to rename a Git branch, both for a specific branch and for the current branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/017-git-branching.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git branch -m wrong-branch-name correct-branch-name
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git branch -m my-branch-name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Staging Changes in Git
DESCRIPTION: Command to stage changes for commit. This prepares modified files to be included in the next commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/022-git-workflow.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git add
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Ignoring Directory with Exception
DESCRIPTION: Example of ignoring a directory while keeping a specific file
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/013-gitignore-file.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
data/*
!data/README.md
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding All Files in Git
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add all files in the current directory to Git tracking using the dot notation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/009-git-add.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git add .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Repository Status
DESCRIPTION: Command to check the current state of the working directory and staging area.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/998-git-commands-cheat-sheet.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git status
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resetting Multiple Commits in Git
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the syntax for resetting multiple commits in Git, where 'n' represents the number of commits to reset.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/019-undoing-in-git.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git reset --soft HEAD~n
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Staging Changed Files with Git
DESCRIPTION: Command to stage modified files in git before committing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/011-git-diff.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git add README.md
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning a GitHub Repository using Git
DESCRIPTION: This command clones a GitHub repository to your local machine. Replace 'your_user' and 'your_repo' with the appropriate GitHub username and repository name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/023-pull-requests.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone git@github.com:your_user/your_repo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Git Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Displays all current Git configuration settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/005-git-configuration.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git config --list
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
user.name=Bobby Iliev
user.email=bobby@bobbyiliev.com
core.repositoryformatversion=0
core.filemode=true
core.bare=false
core.logallrefupdates=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Empty Git Repository Status
DESCRIPTION: Shows the output of git status command on a newly initialized Git repository with no commits or files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/008-git-status.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
On branch main

No commits yet

nothing to commit (create/copy files and use "git add" to track)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a New Branch in Git
DESCRIPTION: This command creates and switches to a new branch in Git. Replace 'branch_name' with your desired branch name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/023-pull-requests.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git checkout -b branch_name
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Multiple Files in Git
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add multiple files at once to Git tracking by listing them with spaces.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/009-git-add.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git add file1.html file2.html file3.html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Git Repository
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new Git repository by initializing the .git directory in the project folder
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/007-initializing-a-project.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git init
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Staging Changes in Git
DESCRIPTION: This command stages all changes in the current directory for commit. Use this after making your code changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/023-pull-requests.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git add .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resolving Merge Conflict
DESCRIPTION: Final command to commit resolved merge conflicts
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/018-git-merge.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git commit -am "Resolve merge conflict"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Comparing Commits with Git Diff
DESCRIPTION: This command shows the differences between the current state of the repository and a specific commit identified by its hash. It displays file changes with additions and deletions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/012-git-log.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git diff fa583473b4be2807b45f35b755aa84ac78922259
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Committing Changes in Git
DESCRIPTION: This command commits the staged changes with a commit message. Replace 'Commit Message' with a descriptive message about your changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/023-pull-requests.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git commit -m "Commit Message"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Git Stash Operation
DESCRIPTION: Basic command to stash away local changes and reset working directory to HEAD commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/026-git-stash.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git stash
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: List All Stashes
DESCRIPTION: Command to display an indexed list of all available stashes with their commit messages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bobbyiliev/introduction-to-git-and-github-ebook/blob/main/ebook/en/content/026-git-stash.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git stash list
```

----------------------------------------
